question.title: How can I make Intellij links the source code of a library in my running microservice, like Eclipse?
question.body:
I have got the source code of a library. Using maven I can mvn install it, it generates a one snapshot jar version in my local m2 repository. And then I have a microservice which uses that library in the POM. Everything works.

In my Eclipse, I can have those two projects opened at the same time, one for the library and the other for the microservice.

With Eclipse, making a change in the source code of the library, without making a full mvn install, just with Automatic Build, it will reflect changes to a microservice when it is running (well, I have got to stop and rerun the microservice) and can see the source code of the library and debug it easily.

In Intellij, I can have two windows on those components (library and microservice that uses it), and from the microservice I can decompile the class and see the decompiled source code. But after making changes in the library, I have to do a mvn install of it, so the microservice will reflect the changes.

Is there a way to make changes in the library that updates a microservice when it is running?

Adding the source folder of the library into the microservice into the modules settings didn't work. Neither pressing the Build button in the library project.

question_comments.body: The answer you are referring to was deleted and is currently only visible to high rep users. I don't see an exact reason. But I speculate that it was deleted because the answer cited a larger paragraph without stating from where that citation is.

I solved it , thanks to an answer someone wrote here, that right now I dont see. I am confused with SOverlfow, honestly. They sugested to add modules. In my case, I went to File->Project Structure, Project Settings-> Modules. I added with the '+' the folder of my lib. I believe it asked me to "existing source" or 'existing module'. And to use Maven project. Now I have two folder in my Intellij windows. Making changes in the lib, they are reflected in the execution of the main microservice. Thanks a lot to everybody!
adding maven projects in the existing intellij window might be of help - see stackoverflow.com/questions/75325571/…
